title: Four men rob O2 shop in Northampton steal display with phones in broad daylight robbery
text:
This is the shocking moment a gang of men steal a display from a mobile phone shop in a 'daylight robbery'.

Mobile phone footage shows four men wearing tracksuits inside the O2 store in Northampton city centre yesterday afternoon.

They suddenly begin trashing the shop with some members of the group clambering on top of a display and stamping on it to free it from its base.

Once they have ripped the display containing multiple smart phones from the store they run out of the door and escape.

Police are aware of the incident but have not yet made any arrests.

This is the shocking moment a gang of men steal a display from the O2 shop in Northampton city centre in a 'daylight robbery'

The clip was uploaded by the twitter account 'Northamptonshire Weather' later that day captioned: 'Daylight robbery at the @TheO2 store in Northampton this afternoon.'

Shocked bystanders could not believe their eyes, with locals commenting on social media.

One said: 'If they do this in broad daylight, what the f*** are they doing when no one is around?! They need to be caught. Those poor staff!'

Another added: 'I can imagine the phones will have been deactivated! I honestly can't believe their brazenness!'

Someone else commented: 'Have to feel for the staff having to be put in danger of these low lives, hope their ok.'

Another Twitter user posted: 'So, so sad. Can't believe that criminals have the front to carry that out in broad daylight. They have no respect or shame! I hope the staff were ok?'

Mobile phone footage shows four men wearing tracksuits inside the O2 store in Northampton city centre yesterday afternoon

They suddenly begin trashing the shop with some members of the group clambering on top of a display and stamping on it to free it from its base

One more person wrote: 'No police presence in town, they know the chances of getting caught are minimal. And if you challenged them and got a kicking, you'd be on your own.'

A Northampton Police said: 'We are aware of footage circulating on social media of robbery at the O2 shop in Abington Street, Northampton.

'Officers were called to this incident at 2.20pm on October 6, when four offenders entered the shop and made off with a display board. This was later abandoned and returned to the shop.

'Detectives investigating the incident are appealing for witnesses. Anyone with information is asked to call Northamptonshire Police on 101 or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555111. Please quote incident number: 252 of 6/10/1.'
description: Mobile phone footage shows four men wearing tracksuits stealing a phone display inside the O2 store in Northampton city centre yesterday afternoon.
